title: development
text: raison d’étre forks package, pronounced /fɔrks/ …

title: development
text: forks package developed extension formula class base R. vctrs package used extend approach formula handling.

title: development
text: thoughts led development package. base formula class, applies modeling relationship descriptions Expansion formulas groups/lists related formulas Fixed protected roles individual terms (e.g. outcomes, exposures, predictors, mediators, confounders) Customized unprotected roles individual terms (specific individual packages) Operations applies individual terms distribution level data Operations apply overall formula , affecting relationships terms Labels individual terms (e.g. mtcars$cyl ~ "Number Cylinders")

title: development
text: vctrs forms base , key concept idea vector types coercion hierarchy. theory, character class considered enriched term class. turn, term class considered enriched formula class. enriched classes term formula implemented vectors type hierarchy, emergent properties develop ascend.

title: development
text: structure package somewhat hierarchical, specific classes generated allow specific functionality higher level.

title: development
text: setting complex program, functions, arguments, inputs, outputs may easier visualize via class UML diagram.

title: development
code: DiagrammeR::grViz(" digraph {  # Graph graph [layout = dot, rankdir = BT]  # Nodes of object classes node [shape = egg, fontname = arial, style = filled, fillcolor = lightcoral, fontcolor = black]  # Nodes of input/argument types node [shape = square, fontname = arial, style = filled, fillcolor = linen, fontcolor = black] fl [label = 'formula list'] rx [label = 'rx'] tm [label = 'term'] ch [label = 'character'] fx [label = 'formula'] rl [label = 'role']   # Edges for terms fx -> tm ch -> tm rl -> ch fx -> ops ops -> tm tm -> rx rx -> fl  } ")

title: forks package — forks-package
text: package provides simple interface expanding upon `formula` class introducing additional attributes, specific roles, labels, groups individual terms. allows formulas expanded create families formulas related, using formula lists. driven need clear intentional relationship descriptions, particularly causal modeling space.

title: Formula vector — frx
text: function defines new modified formula class vectorized. expands upon functionality formulas.

title: Formula vector — frx
code: formula_rx(x = unspecified(), ...)  # S3 method for term_rx formula_rx(   x,   roles = list(),   groups = list(),   labels = list(),   pattern = character(),   ... )  # S3 method for formula formula_rx(   x,   roles = list(),   groups = list(),   labels = list(),   pattern = character(),   ... )  # S3 method for default formula_rx(x, ...)  frx(x = unspecified(), ...)

title: Formula vector — frx
text: x Objects following types can used inputs term_rx ... Arguments passed methods roles Specific roles variable plays within formula. particular importance, serve special terms can effect formula interpreted. options roles : exposure X(...): predictor variable serves primary key variable \(Exposure ~ Outcome\) relationship Formulas can condensed applying specific role individual terms function/wrapper. example, y ~ X(x1) + x2 + x3. signify x1 specific role exposure. groups List formulas term (terms) LHS group name RHS (quotations indicate character value necessary). E.g. list(c(x1, x2) ~ grp) pattern expansion pattern used decide covariates incorporated formulas. options c("direct", "sequential", "parallel"). See details explanation. direct: covariates included formula sequential: covariates added sequentially, one one, groups, indicated parallel: covariates groups covariates placed parallel

title: Formula vector — frx
text: object class formula_rx

title: Formula vector — frx
text: expansion pattern allows instructions covariates included different formulas. , assuming x1, x2, x3 covariates... $$y ~ x1 + x2 + x3$$ Direct: $$y ~ x1 + x2 + x3$$ Seqential: $$y ~ x1$$ $$y ~ x1 + x2$$ $$y ~ x1 + x2 + x3$$ Parallel: $$y ~ x1$$ $$y ~ x2$$ $$y ~ x3$$

title: Prescribed Formula Lists — list_of_formulas

See details explanation. direct: covariates included formula sequential: covariates added sequentially, one one, groups, indicated parallel: covariates groups covariates placed parallel
